member_organisations: A list of ABI member companies can be found on the ABI website https://www.abi.org.uk/About/ABI-members
fields_of_interest: Economy, finance and the euro, Trade, Competition, Consumers, Employment and Social Affairs, Business and Industry, Environment, Taxation, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Single market, External Relations, Public Health, Digital economy and society, Transport, Climate Action, Borders and Security, Banking and financial services
eu_initiatives: Solvency II, Insurance Distribution Directive, Packaged Retail  Insurance based Investment Products (PRIIPs), General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR), ESA review, Long-term investment, IFRS, Recovery and resolution non-banks, Capital Markets Union (CMU), Motor insurance directive, collective redress, Brexit.
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
membership:
The ABI is a member of: 
Insurance Europe - http://www.insuranceeurope.eu   
Global Federation of Insurance Associations (GFIA) - http://www.gfiainsurance.org/en/
goals__remit: The Association of British Insurers (ABI) is the leading trade association for insurers and providers of long term savings. Our 250 members include most household names and specialist providers who contribute £12bn in taxes and manage investments of £1.6trillion. Through the ABI their voice is heard in Government and in public debate on insurance, savings, and investment matters. And through the ABI they come together to improve customers' experience of the industry, to raise standards of corporate governance in British business and to protect the public against crime.
relevant_communication:
Consultation responses.  
Meetings with European Commission officials involved in key initiatives. 
Meeting with MEPs and MEP offices as appropriate. 
Use of/informing media as appropriate.
position: Assistant Director, Head of European and International Affairs
